title:
A note on quasi-transitive graphs quasi-isometric to planar (Cayley)
  graphs
abstract:
Given a connected, locally finite, quasi-transitive graph $X$ which is
quasi-isometric to a planar graph $\Gamma$, we remark that one can upgrade
$\Gamma$ to be a planar Cayley graph, answering a question raised by
Esperet--Giocanti and Hamann.
